meanings.definition: A short, stiff hair or filament
meanings.sent1: The hedgehog's back was covered in bristles.
meanings.sent2: She brushed her hand against the cat's bristles.
meanings.sent3: The porcupine's bristles stood up when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent4: The old brush had lost most of its bristles over time.
meanings.sent5: The artist used tiny bristles to paint intricate details.

meanings.sent1: He bristles at any criticism of his work.
meanings.sent2: She bristles whenever someone questions her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The cat bristles when the dog comes too close to its food.
meanings.sent4: The teacher bristles when students talk during the lesson.
meanings.sent5: The politician bristles at the mention of his opponent's name.

meanings.definition: To be covered with bristles or similar projections
meanings.sent1: The cactus bristles with sharp spines.
meanings.sent2: His face bristles with anger as he hears the news.
meanings.sent3: The tree trunk seems to bristle with tiny insects.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar's body bristles with colorful hairs.
meanings.sent5: The warrior's armor bristles with spikes for protection.
